description.narrative: Hurricane Dorian made landfall as a category 5 hurricane and impacted the Northern islands of The Bahamas from 1 to September 3rd 2019 for approx. 68 hours. The hurricane devastated Abaco, Grand Bahama and the surrounding Cays. It impacted Abaco with maximum sustained winds of 185 mph (295 km/h). Â The total number of deceased persons recovered since the passing of Hurricane Dorian revised to 74 (63 in Abaco and 11 in Grand Bahama) as the police recovered remains of unidentified bodies in February 2020. About 29,472 persons in 9,000 homes were affected by Dorian, in excess of 11 million square feet of structures have sustained some damage on the two islands. In Abaco, more than 75% of the dwellings were somehow affected; approximately 57% of the houses were severely damaged. Central Abaco (Marsh Harbour), Treasure Cay, and Hope Town were the most affected locations. Vulnerable settlements in Marsh Harbour were also destroyed. Damage to the housing sector on the islands of Abaco and Grand Bahama is estimated at $1.48 billion, 88.9% of which took place on Abaco. Housing was the sector most severely affected by Hurricane Dorian. Several residential settlements along or near the coastline suffered heavy damage as a result of the intense force of winds and storm surge or were impacted by falling trees and flying debris. Houses and residences suffered significant damage to the structural elements, roofs, flood damage, and other components of the buildings.
